Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Version Wildcards do not work in some build tools" (#13105) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Per the MSFT Pages, a library may be referenced in C# as `<PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting" Version="6.*" />` which works in VS2022, but not from the command lines of `dotnet`, `msbuild`, etc. It gives various errors about not being able to restore the nuget package. See this MSFT Page: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/package-references-in-project-files

### Repro Steps

1. Make a simple project
2. Add a reference
3. Change the reference to have wildcards

### Expected Behavior

Program builds

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget Sources List into table style structure" (#13011) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet.exe, dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

Currently when trying to list all the sources e.g. `nuget sources` or `dotnet nuget source list` the result is in a string array like so

```
[0] = NuGet Version: 6.7.0.127
[1] = Registered Sources:
[2] =  1.  nuget.org [Enabled]
[3] =       https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
[4] =  2.  Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages [Enabled]
[5] =       C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\
```

### Desired Behavior

The output should be a in table style format that can be easily parsed via Powershell or Bash into something like this
```
[0] = { "source", "isEnabled", "location" }
[1] = { "nuget.org", true, "https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" }
[2] = { "Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages", true, " C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\" }
```

### Additional Context

I would like to script some nuget source changes e.g. updating multiple sources at once

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS Package Manager Console should close Text View" (#13104) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

all

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

None

### Repro Steps & Context

VS' Package Manager Console creates an IVsTextView to render the PowerShell output, but doesn't ever close it.

This is just a technicality, as PMC is a VS Tool Window, which only gets hidden when the customer facing windows is closed. Hence, the class is a singleton and is only disposed when VS is closed. But, technically PMC isn't cleaning up after itself correctly.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug Bash] [Doc] No F1 help doc was found when clicking the Help button at the top right of the “Configuration Files” node " (#13103) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.9.0.67

### Worked before?

This is not a regression since it is a new feature.   

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:       

1.Create a C# Console App (.NET Core 8.0) project in VS and open the PM UI or PMC window.   
2.Click the settings button (gear button) on PM UI or PMC window.   
3. Click the “NuGet Package Manager->Configuration Files” in the opened “Options” window. 
4. Click the help button(?) at the top right of the “Configuration Files” node. 

 

#### Expected:     

There should be a help file about “Configuration Files” node. 

#### Actual:        

No F1 help doc was found about “Configuration Files” node as below: 
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/84695155/2726a8e0-c584-4e3b-9244-12a6b625e144)

 #### Note:    

The repro rate is 100%.  

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Do not use an exact version, but cause NU1106." (#13101) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

.NET SDK:  Version:   7.0.404  Commit:    22f221a24c

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

I created a project and referenced two packages.
```
<ItemGroup>
	<PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Management.Services.CloudPC.Reporting.Extensions" Version="2.1.0"/>
	<PackageReference Include="Microsoft.CloudManagedDesktop.ReliabilityCommon.Core.Function" Version="1.0.2537.81"/>
</ItemGroup>
```
These two packages depend on some same packages but not the same version.
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/36906182/93ee8d86-45d4-4f89-881f-f76f208d079b)

**What I expected:**
As documents mentioned, [lowest applicable version](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/concepts/dependency-resolution#lowest-applicable-version) rule will applied and version 5.1.8 can be chosen.

**What I got:**
`Unable to satisfy conflicting requests for 'Microsoft.CloudManagedDesktop.Core.Flighting': Microsoft.CloudManagedDesktop.Core.Flighting (>= 5.1.8) (via package/Microsoft.CloudManagedDesktop.ReliabilityCommon.Core.Function 1.0.2537.81), Microsoft.CloudManagedDesktop.Core.Flighting (>= 5.0.6) (via package/Microsoft.Management.Services.CloudPC.Reporting.Client 2.1.0), Microsoft.CloudManagedDesktop.Core.Flighting (>= 5.0.6) (via package/Microsoft.Management.Services.CloudPC.AzureWrappers 5.0.6) Framework: (.NETCoreApp,Version=v6.0)`

I know how to fix it, just apply [direct-dependency-wins](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/concepts/dependency-resolution#direct-dependency-wins) rule, but I do not understand why this error happened.
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/assets/36906182/6f4c9e34-7028-4455-9fd3-633586bcec1d)

Can you help me answer this question? If necessary, please correct this erroneous statement and update this case in the documentation. Thank you.


### Verbose Logs

```shell
Details can be found in [project.assets.json](http://home.xiaoshiyi.online:177/kodbox/?explorer/share/fileOut&shareID=99ZiI39A&path=%7BshareItemLink%3A99ZiI39A%7D%2F&name=/project.assets.json&download=1)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Connection] Deprecating legacy cipher suites at www.nuget.org" (#63) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
In order to provide a more secure and compliant environment for our customers, we are planning to deprecate legacy cipher suites and only support the following cipher suites at [www.nuget.org](http://www.nuget.org/):

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

Between 08/31/2022 07:00 PM UTC and 09/02/2022 07:00 PM UTC, we will take a test for this deprecation to understand the broken change for our customers. Based on our telemetry, we expect the impact to be minimal, but if you meet any connection issues at [www.nuget.org](http://www.nuget.org/) or have any questions, do reach out to us at [support@nuget.org](mailto:support@nuget.org) or by commenting on the discussion issue: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9216. We will be closely monitoring our communication channels to assess any unexpected impact.
